description.p: This document describes how/what to prepare for the two GP courses.

ul.li: In this directory, create a src subdirectory and copy the gp.example sources here
Create also a bin subdirectory and a doc subdirectory and copy the GP API javadoc to the latter
Unzip the NetBeans IDE into this directory (creating a directory netbeans)
If the computer is to be run without network connection during the course, the OpenAPI javadoc should be installed in the netbeans directory as well (e.g. in a subdirectory named docs)
Install the GP.jar and the logging.jar in the C:\GPCourse\modules directory
Add a gif-file (to be used as icon) to the C:\GPCourse directory and call it exampleIcon.gif
Make sure there is a java installation

description.p:
The second course continues where the first left off, but some preparations are necessary.
The C:\GPCourse directory should be prepared as for the first course. Make sure the API support module for the NetBeans IDE has been installed
The gpcourse package is provided in a zip-file and should be added to C:\GPCourse\src directory.
A netbeans_platform directory has also been prepared in a zip-file, this should be unzipped in the C:\GPCourse directory. Make sure that the C:\GPCourse\netbeans_platform\nb.bat file runs
